member.name: M:DevExpress.XtraTreeList.CustomDrawRowFooterCellEventHandler.Invoke(System.Object,DevExpress.XtraTreeList.CustomDrawRowFooterCellEventArgs)

summary.para: Represents a method that will handle the event.

member.param: The event sender (typically the control).
A object that contains data related to the event.

summary.para: Specifies summary type to calculate against a group of column cells.
Calculates the average field value within a group of column cells.
Calculates the number of nodes within a group of column cells.
Allows a user to define a custom summary value by handling the event.
Retrieves the maximum value within a group of column cells.
Retrieves the minimum value within a group of column cells.
Summary is not calculated.
Calculates the sum of field values within a group of column cells.
Contains settings that define the visibility of editor buttons within a cell.
Buttons are always displayed.
Buttons are displayed only for the focused cell.
Buttons are displayed for all cell editors in the focused row.
Buttons are displayed only when a cell editor is active.
Specifies the printing options of the XtraTreeList.

If active, printed nodes' height is calculated with respect to the font applied considering that each node contains a single text line. Otherwise, printed nodes' height is determined by their height within the control.
If active, printed columns are stretched to occupy a single page width (except margins).
This option is activated automatically when all other options are disabled.
If active, expands all collapsed nodes for printing out.
If active, enables printing of the indent with the "OddRow" and "EvenRow" styles.
If active, enables printing of the horizontal lines.
If active, enables printing of the images.
If active, enables printing of columns at the top of every report page.
If active, enables printing of the preview section.
If active, enables printing of the summary footer on the last report page.
If active, enables printing of the row footer summary.
If active, enables printing of the tree lines.
If active, enables printing of the node state buttons. This option is in effect only when the PrintTree option is active.
If active, enables printing of the vertical lines.
If active, the TreeList control is printed using its print styles accessible via the property. Otherwise, control styles are used for printing.
Specifies the tree line style for the current control.
Sets the control tree line style to Dark.
Sets the control tree line style to Large.
Sets the control tree line style to Light.
Hides tree lines.
Sets the control tree line style to Percent50.
Sets the control tree line style to Solid.
Sets the control tree line style to Wide.
Lists values that identify different elements of the XtraTreeList control.

A point is over the column header to the right of the last column header. This can take place only if the option is disabled. The total width of columns can be less than the control's width in this case.
A point is over a group button. Group button are displayed for nodes that have children. You can hide these button by disabling the option.
A point is over a cell.
A point is over a column header. Column headers are visible by default. You can hide them by disabling the option.
A point is over the column button. The column button is displayed if both the column header panel and indicator panel are visible. This implies that the and options are enabled.
A point is over a column edge.
A point is over the customization form. Please refer to the method description for details the way this form can be invoked and its purpose.
A point is over the area not occupied by other elements.
A point is outside the XtraTreeList control.
A point is over a node area not occupied by any of the node's elements.
A point is over a row footer. You must enable the option to display row footers.

A point is over the area that separates a row from the corresponding indicator cell. This value is returned only when the option is enabled. Otherwise, the Empty value is returned when a point is over this area.
A point is over a row indicator cell. The indicator is displayed by default. You can hide it by disabling the option.
A point is over a row indicator edge.
A point is over a row preview. Preview sections are displayed only if the option is enabled.
A point is over a node's select image. Please see the property description for details on assigning select images to nodes.
A point is over a node's state image. Please see the property description for details on assigning state images to nodes.
A point is over the summary footer. The summary footer is displayed only if the option is enabled.
Specifies the data format for the class.
Sets the column format in order to represent DateTime data.
Does not specify any special data format.
Sets the column format in order to represent numeric data.
Specifies the manner in which a column is sorted.
Nodes are sorted by column values in ascending order.
Nodes are sorted by column values in descending order.
No sorting is applied to the current column.
Contains flags which define functionality.
If active, the column can receive focus using the mouse or keyboard.

If active, the column can be moved by dragging its header. End users can move columns either to a new position within the column header panel or to the customization form. You can additionaly use the CanMovedToCustomizationForm option to specify whether the column can be moved to the customizaton form.

If active, users can drag this column header to the customization form. Otherwise the column can be hidden only by setting its property to -1 via code. This option is in effect only when the CanMoved option is enabled.
If active, the column can be resized by dragging the right edge of its header.
If active, the column can be sorted. Otherwise sorting against this column cannot be implemented either by end users or in code.
If active, the width of the column is not changed in auto-width mode (the flag is active), regardless of changes to the XtraTreeList's size.
If active, disables all other options.
If active, data within the column cannot be modified.
If active, the column is not displayed in the customization form regardless of the property value.
Contains flags specifying the behavior of the XtraTreeList control.

If active the parent field value of the dragged node is automatically set to the key field value of the node that becomes its parent as the result of drag-and-drop performed. Users are allowed to drag nodes only when the DragNodes option is active.

para.para: If active, pressing the right arrow key or CTRL-TAB combination, when the last cell of a node is focused, results in focusing the first cell of the next node. If the first cell of a node is focused, pressing the left arrow key results in focusing the last cell of the previous row.
If the AutoMoveRowFocus option is disabled, the mentioned key combinations cannot be used to navigate through nodes. Only the up and down arrow keys can be used for this purpose in such a case.

Note: when the UseTabKey option is enabled, you can also use the tab key to navigate through cells forward. If the EnterMovesNextColumn option is active, you can also use the ENTER key for this purpose.

summary.para: If active, the height of each node is determined by the maximum height of the editor within it. The editor's height is determined by its content. For instance, if the memo editor is used to edit cell values, the node is resized to accommodate all text lines within the editor.
If active, cell editor contents are automatically selected when users start editing a cell.
If active, nodes are copied when dropped. Otherwise dropped nodes are moved to their new location. Drag-and-drop operations on nodes are allowed only if the DragNodes option is active.
If active, allows to move or copy nodes using drag-and-drop operations. Use the CanCloneNodesOnDrop to specify the effect of dropping the dragged node.
If active, allows editing cells within the XtraTreeList control.

para.para: If active, pressing the ENTER key when editing a cell moves focus to the next cell and activates the editor for it. Otherwise, the focused cell's editor is closed and the cell remains focused.
Pressing the ENTER key when no editing is being performed, results in activating the editor for the focused cell. This doesn't depend on the EnterMovesNextColumn option settings.

summary.para: If active, nodes are expanded when the dragged node hovers over them.

If active, cell editors are activated after a user has pressed and released the left mouse button when the pointer is over the cell. Otherwise, editors are activated immediately after the left mouse button has been pressed.
If active, end users can navigate through cells using arrow keys while editing.
If active, several rows can be selected at a time. Click a row or an indicator cell holding the SHIFT or CTRL button for this purpose.
If active, disables all other options.
If active, the method call creates columns that are bound to fields specified by the , and properties. Otherwise, columns bound to these fields are not generated.
If active, nodes' height can be changed by end users. An indicator cell edge must be dragged for this purpose.
If active, a tool tip displaying the cell value appears when the mouse pointer hovers over the cell.

para.para: If active, end users can use the TAB and SHIFT-TAB keys to navigate through cells forward and backward respectively. Otherwise, these keys move focus to the next or previous control in the tab order. In this case, the right arrow key and CTRL-TAB combination can be used to navigate through cells.
